oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Winfield Scott
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Standing portrait of Winfield Scott in military uniform. One hand in his jacket and the other resting on a column having a curtain draped on it. Beside him is a table and chair. On top of the table is Scott's hat. Winfield Scott Photograph by Brady expressly for this work.
U.S. Army general commanding forces in the War of 1812, the Black Hawk War, Second Seminole War, and the Civil War. Defeated in the presidental election of 1852.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Scott, Winfield, 1786-1866
Scott, Winfield, 1786-1866;Chippewa, Battle of, Ont., 1814;Lundy's Lane, Battle of, Ont., 1814;U.S. Army campaigns of the War of 1812
Military;Uniforms
